thread.title: McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS
thread.title_full: McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS

author: DAVE SKRETTA
title: McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS
text:
Orlin Wagner McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS 
Houston Astros' George Springer celebrates after his solo home run during the fifth inning in Game 1 of baseball's American League Division Series against the Kansas City Royals, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Orlin Wagner) Charlie Riedel McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS 
Kansas City Royals' Kendrys Morales watches his solo home run during the fourth inning in Game 1 of baseball's American League Division Series against the Houston Astros, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) Charlie Riedel McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS 
Houston Astros' Jose Altuve, right, is tagged out by Kansas City Royals second baseman Ben Zobrist, left, while trying to steal second base during the fifth inning in Game 1 of baseball's American League Division Series, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) Orlin Wagner McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS 
Kansas City Royals' Ben Zobrist, right, steals second base as Houston Astros second baseman Jose Altuve, left, leaps for the throw during the first inning in Game 1 of baseball's American League Division Series, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Orlin Wagner) Orlin Wagner McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS 
Jets fly over Kauffman Stadium before Game 1 of baseball's American League Division Series between the Kansas City Royals and the Houston Astros, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Orlin Wagner) Posted: Thursday, October 8, 2015 11:44 pm McHugh pitches Astros to 5-2 win over Royals to open ALDS Associated Press | 0 comments 
KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) — The Houston Astros beat the Kansas City Royals at their own game Thursday night, relying on sharp pitching from Collin McHugh and stingy defense behind him for a 5-2 victory in the opener of their AL Division Series. 
McHugh (1-0) allowed four hits, including a pair of solo homers by Kendrys Morales, while pitching around a 49-minute rain delay. The right-hander lasted six innings before turning the game over to his bullpen, which scattered just three runners over the final three frames. kAm%@?J $:AA[ (:== w2CC:D 2?5 ~=:G6C !6C6K 8@E E96 82>6 E@ {F<6 vC686CD@?[ A2CE @7 ~2<=2?5VD H:=5\42C5 4@==2AD6 :? z2?D2D r:EJ =2DE J62C] w6 92?5=65 E96 ?:?E9 E@ 62C?
